External id.Description: Unique identifier of image as provided by image capture platform

Donor info - LIMS ID.Description: Unique donor identifier generated by Powers Laboratory LIMS

Donor info - Program ID.Description: Unique identifier from source initiative or program

Donor info - Disease Status.Description: Disease associated with donor, as defined by clinical history

Donor info - Disease Duration.Description: Time that disease was known/diagnosed in donor

Donor info - Age.Description: Age of donor at time of sample collection

Sample info - Section Plane.Description: Plane along which pancreas was sectioned (sagittal, coronal, transverse)

Sample info - Pancreas Region.Description: Anatomical region from which section was collected (pancreas head, body, tail).

Image info - Pancreas Region.Description: Anatomical region from which section was collected (pancreas head, body, tail).

Image info - Section Plane.Description: Plane along which pancreas was sectioned (sagittal, coronal, transverse)

Image info - Modality.Description: Imaging modality and/or platform utilized to collect data

ACTB.Antigen description: Beta-actin; highly conserved protein that provides cellular structure and motility

AMY1A.Antigen description: Amylase alpha 1a; secreted protein helping to catalyze digestion of dietary starch and glycogen

CA2.Antigen description: Carbonic anhydrase II; catalyzes reversible hydration of carbon dioxide

CD3.Antigen description: Co-receptor helping to activate cytotoxic T cells and helper T cells

CD4 (LEU3A).Antigen description: MHC class II co-receptor involved in thymic differentiation and lymphocyte adhesion
CD4 (LEU3A).Pancreas cell/region specificity: Helper T cells, monocytes, macrophages, DCs

CD8 (LEU2).Antigen description: MHC class I co-receptor with roles in thymic differentiation and T cell activation

CD11b.Antigen description: Integrin subunit; also known as macrophage-1 antigen (Mac-1) or complement receptor 3 (CR3)

CD14.Antigen description: Surface antigen involved with innate immune response to bacterial lipopolysaccharide

CD20.Antigen description: B-lymphocyte antigen; plays a role in B cell development and differentiation

CD31 (PECAM1).Antigen description: Platelet and endothelial cell adhesion molecule 1

CD34.Antigen description: Mucin-like transmembrane glycoprotein involved in cell-cell adhesion
CD34.Pancreas cell/region specificity: Mucin-like transmembrane glycoprotein involved in cell-cell adhesion, stromal cells

CD44.Antigen description: Cell-surface glycoprotein involved in lymphocyte activation and hematopoiesis; interacts with hyaluronic acid, osteopontin, collagens, and matrix metalloproteinases

CD45 (PTPRC).Antigen description: Protein tyrosine phosphatase, receptor type C

CD45 (RO).Antigen description: Low molecular weight isoform of CD45; functions in T and B cell receptor signaling

CD56 (NCAM).Antigen description: Neural cell adhesion molecule; archetypal phenotypic marker of NK cells
CD56 (NCAM).Pancreas cell/region specificity: NK cells and other immune cells

CD57 (HNK1, LEU7).Antigen description: Carbohydrate epitope created by enzymatic activity of galactosylgalactosylxylosylprotein 3-beta-glucuronosyltransferase 1 (B3GAT1)
CD57 (HNK1, LEU7).Pancreas cell/region specificity: NK cells, CD8+ T cells, neural cells

CD68.Antigen description: Transmembrane glycoprotein predominantly expressed in late endosomes and lysosomes; high levels are associated with increased macrophage homing

CD99 (MIC2).Antigen description: Transmembrane protein involved in cell adhesion, apoptosis, vesicular protein transport, and T cell differentiation

COL.Antigen description: Collagen, general; triple helix protein providing majority of structural support in extracellular space

COL4A1.Antigen description: Collagen type IV, alpha 1 chain; integral component of basement membranes

CPA1.Antigen description: Carboxypeptidase A1; enzyme that cleaves branched-chain and aromatic amino acids from dietary proteins

CPEP.Antigen description: Connecting peptide (C-peptide); 31-aa polypeptide that arises from cleavage of proinsulin

FOXA2.Antigen description: Forkhead box A2; transcription factor that influences α cell development, maturation

FOXP3.Antigen description: Transcription factor essential for the production and function of regulatory T cells, aiding in protection from autoimmunity

GFAP.Antigen description: Glial fibrillary acidic protein; intermediate filament in mature astrocytes

GITR.Antigen description: Glucocorticoid-induced TNF receptor; co-stimulatory immune checkpoint molecule that mediates suppressive activity of Tregs and survival of effector T cells

GZMB.Antigen description: Serine protease released by cytoplasmic granules to induce programmed cell death

HLA-ABC.Antigen description: Major histocompatibility complex (MHC) class I antigens

HLA-DR.Antigen description: Major histocompatibility complex (MHC) class II antigen

HPd3.Antigen description: Cell surface marker characterized by Drs. Dorrell, Streeter, and Grompe; hybridoma clone DHIC5-4D9

HNF1B*.Antigen description: Hepatocyte nuclear factor 1-beta; transcription factor critical for pancreatic development
HNF1B*.Pancreas cell/region specificity: Pancreatic progenitor cells (De Vas et al. 2002; adult ductal cells (Nammo et al.)

Ki67.Antigen description: Nuclear protein associated with cellular proliferation

KRT.Antigen description: Pan-keratin; family of fibrous structural proteins providing cellular mechanical support

LAM.Antigen description: Laminin, general; family of secreted trimeric proteins with cross-like structures that act as the major scaffold for basal lamina

NES.Antigen description: Nestin; intermediate filament protein expressed in dividing cells, most often during early stages of nervous system differentiation

NFkB.Antigen description: Protein complex with a critical role in regulating inflammation, including DNA transcription, cytokine production, and cell survival

NKX2-2.Antigen description: NK2 homeobox 2; key transcription factor in endocrine cell development
NKX2-2.Pancreas cell/region specificity: β cells (Sussel et al. 1998, Jennings et al. 2013)

NKX6-1*.Antigen description: NK6 homeobox; transcription factor required for β cell development

PAX6.Antigen description: Paired box 6; key transcription factor in endocrine development

PDX1*.Antigen description: Pancreatic and duodenal homeobox 1; key transcription factor in pancreatic development

pS6.Antigen description: Phospho-S6 ribosomal protein; marker of cell cycle progression

SCG3.Antigen description: Secretogranin III, involved in secretory granule biogenesis

SYN1.Antigen description: Synapsin I, neuronal phosphoprotein associated with synaptic vesicles

SYN2.Antigen description: Synapsin II, neuronal phosphoprotein associated with synaptic vesicles

SYP.Antigen description: Synaptophysin, integral membrane protein of small synaptic vesicles

TUBB3.Antigen description: Neuron-specific class III beta-tubulin; core component of microtubules

asterisk.description: Denotes genes associated with Maturity-Onset Diabetes Of The Young (MODY) or neonatal diabetes

Congo red.Description: Synthetic azo dye with hydrophobic and electrostatic properties that enable its binding to amyloid fibrils

DAPI.Description: 4′,6-diamidino-2-phenylindole; binds strongly to adenine–thymine rich regions in DNA

Eosin.Description: Red or pink acidic compound that binds to acidophilic substances, such as positively charged amino-acid side chains

H&E.Description: Hematoxylin & Eosin (standard pathology stain to visualize tissue structure)

Hematoxylin.Description: Naturally derived dark blue/violet dye that binds to basophilic substances, such as DNA and RNA

Thioflavin S.Description: Dye used to non-quantitatively visualize amyloid fibrils through elevated fluorescence emission

Trichrome.Description: Histological stain that uses a combination of acidic dyes and a polyelectrolyte to visually differentiate cells from connective tissue; collagen turns blue

TUNEL.Description: Terminal deoxynucleotidyl transferase dUTP nick end labeling (TUNEL); uses tagged TdT to visualize blunt ends of double-stranded DNA breaks

Sagittal.Description: Plane cutting “cross-sections” or dividing organ into left and right sections

Transverse.Description: Plane dividing into upper and lower segments; also called horizontal or axial

Anatomical Region.Description:
Head: located next to duodenum

Body: located posterior to distal portion of stomach

Tail: located adjacent to spleen

Imaging Region.Description:
Core: refers to central region of transverse section

Periphery: refers to outer edge of transverse section

ROI: Region of Interest (arbitrary)
